00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 * $Id$          pwm_match_int.c                                 2010-05-21
00003 */
00025 #include "lpc17xx_pwm.h"
00026 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00028 
00029 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00035 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00036 // Time out definition - used in blocking mode in read/write function
00037 #define TIME_OUT        10000
00038 
00039 
00040 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00041 __IO uint32_t match_cnt = 0;
00042 __IO uint32_t long_duty = 0;
00043 
00044 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00045 /* Interrupt service routine */
00046 void PWM1_IRQHandler(void);
00047 
00048 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00049 /*********************************************************************/
00054 void PWM1_IRQHandler(void)
00055 {
00056         /* Check whether if match flag for channel 0 is set or not */
00057         if (PWM_GetIntStatus(LPC_PWM1, PWM_INTSTAT_MR0))
00058         {
00059                 match_cnt++;
00060                 /* Clear the interrupt flag */
00061                 PWM_ClearIntPending(LPC_PWM1, PWM_INTSTAT_MR0);
00062         }
00063 }
00064 
00065 
00066 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00067 /*********************************************************************/
00072 int c_entry(void)
00073 {
00074         uint8_t temp, temp2;
00075         PWM_TIMERCFG_Type PWMCfgDat;
00076         PWM_MATCHCFG_Type PWMMatchCfgDat;
00077         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00078 
00079         /* PWM block section -------------------------------------------- */
00080         /* Initialize PWM peripheral, timer mode
00081          * PWM prescale value = 1 (absolute value - tick value) */
00082         PWMCfgDat.PrescaleOption = PWM_TIMER_PRESCALE_TICKVAL;
00083         PWMCfgDat.PrescaleValue = 1;
00084         PWM_Init(LPC_PWM1, PWM_MODE_TIMER, (void *) &PWMCfgDat);
00085 
00086         /*
00087          * Initialize PWM pin connect
00088          */
00089         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00090         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00091         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00092         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00093         for (temp = 0; temp <= 6; temp++){
00094                 PinCfg.Pinnum = temp;
00095                 PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00096         }
00097 
00098 
00099         /* Set match value for PWM match channel 0 = 256, update immediately */
00100         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 0, 256, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00101         /* PWM Timer/Counter will be reset when channel 0 matching
00102          * Enable interrupt when match
00103          * no stop when match */
00104         PWMMatchCfgDat.IntOnMatch = ENABLE;
00105         PWMMatchCfgDat.MatchChannel = 0;
00106         PWMMatchCfgDat.ResetOnMatch = ENABLE;
00107         PWMMatchCfgDat.StopOnMatch = DISABLE;
00108         PWM_ConfigMatch(LPC_PWM1, &PWMMatchCfgDat);
00109 
00110         /* Configure each PWM channel: --------------------------------------------- */
00111         /* - Single edge
00112          * - PWM Duty on each PWM channel determined by
00113          * the match on channel 0 to the match of that match channel.
00114          * Example: PWM Duty on PWM channel 1 determined by
00115          * the match on channel 0 to the match of match channel 1.
00116          */
00117 
00118         /* Configure PWM channel edge option
00119          * Note: PWM Channel 1 is in single mode as default state and
00120          * can not be changed to double edge mode */
00121         for (temp = 2; temp < 7; temp++)
00122         {
00123                 PWM_ChannelConfig(LPC_PWM1, temp, PWM_CHANNEL_SINGLE_EDGE);
00124         }
00125 
00126         /* Setting interrupt for PWM ---------------------------------------------- */
00127     /* Disable PWM interrupt */
00128     NVIC_DisableIRQ(PWM1_IRQn);
00129     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00130     NVIC_SetPriority(PWM1_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00131 
00132         /* Configure match value for each match channel */
00133         temp2 = 10;
00134         for (temp = 1; temp < 7; temp++)
00135         {
00136                 /* Set up match value */
00137                 PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, temp, temp2, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00138                 /* Configure match option */
00139                 PWMMatchCfgDat.IntOnMatch = DISABLE;
00140                 PWMMatchCfgDat.MatchChannel = temp;
00141                 PWMMatchCfgDat.ResetOnMatch = DISABLE;
00142                 PWMMatchCfgDat.StopOnMatch = DISABLE;
00143                 PWM_ConfigMatch(LPC_PWM1, &PWMMatchCfgDat);
00144                 /* Enable PWM Channel Output */
00145                 PWM_ChannelCmd(LPC_PWM1, temp, ENABLE);
00146                 /* Increase match value by 10 */
00147                 temp2 += 10;
00148         }
00149 
00150     /* Enable PWM interrupt */
00151     NVIC_EnableIRQ(PWM1_IRQn);
00152 
00153         /* Reset and Start counter */
00154         PWM_ResetCounter(LPC_PWM1);
00155         PWM_CounterCmd(LPC_PWM1, ENABLE);
00156 
00157         /* Start PWM now */
00158         PWM_Cmd(LPC_PWM1, ENABLE);
00159 
00160         // Update PWM1.1 every 0x1000 match interrupt
00161         while (1)
00162         {
00163                 if (match_cnt >= 0x1000) {
00164                         match_cnt = 0;
00165                         long_duty++;
00166                         if (long_duty >= 256) {
00167                                 // Reset duty
00168                                 long_duty = 0;
00169                                 // Print info
00170                                 //UART_Puts_(uartdev, "PWM1.1 is reset!");
00171                         }
00172 
00173                         // Update PWM1.1 duty
00174                         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 1, long_duty, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00175                 }
00176         }
00177     return 1;
00178 }
00179 
00180 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00181    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00182    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00183    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00184    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00185 int main(void)
00186 {
00187     return c_entry();
00188 }

00191 #ifdef  DEBUG

00193 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00194 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00195 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00196 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00197 * @return               None
00198 *******************************************************************************/
00199 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00200 {
00201         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00202          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00203 
00204         /* Infinite loop */
00205         while(1);
00206 }
